name: Hilary Putnam
thesis_title: The Meaning of the Concept of Probability in Application to Finite Sequences
doctoral_students: Paul Benacerraf, George Boolos, David Kellogg Lewis  '''Hilary Whitehall Putnam''' (July 31, 1926 – March 13, 2016
archiveurl: https://web.archive.org/web/20110709060653/http://www.philosophers.co.uk/cafe/phil_jun2002.htm  Up until his death, Putnam was Cogan University Professor Emeritus at Harvard University.  In philosophy of mind, Putnam is known for his argument against the type-identity of mental and physical states based on his hypothesis of the multiple realizability of the mental, and for the concept of functionalism, an influential theory regarding the mind–body problem.<ref name
